Articles.Content:
*"Orbit" means the lateral movement of your craft across Eve in a clock-wise direction, similar to what it would be on Venus in real life. See Rule #4.
**Use of Hyperedit is prohibited for everything except tests of your design. ²I don't need pictures of your tests, however, you are welcome to provide your development process.
†See modlist.
††Not compatible with anything of similar fashion. E.g. having ten Kerbals is not compatible with twenty Kerbals. You only get points for the twenty Kerbals, not twenty and ten. Applies to more than two terms also.

The Eve Luxury Floatation Aerostat Habitat (ELFAH) challenge is one of the hardest, most captivating, and most difficult ones in the history of Eve challenges.

As some of you might've known, the HAVOC project has been developed by NASA. The plan consists of five steps:

  1. Robotic exploration into the Venusian atmosphere
  2. Crewed mission to orbit Venus for 30 days
  3. Crewed mission to Venusian atmosphere for 30 days
  4. Crewed mission to Venusian atmosphere for 1 year
  5. Long-term human presence in a floating balloon.

This, as-well as my own fantasies, has challenged me to get back into KSP and try this out. However, this summer I am moving to California, and my YouTube channel is taking a very serious turn now, so uploading a silly KSP video will be..well..silly. Therefore, I challenge you, the KSP forum community, to complete this challenge! I did do something very similar about a year ago, and it worked alright until I lost control of the ship and crashed into this mountain over here:

http://i.imgur.com/ThEbQGO.png

Now, for the challenge rules and similar, less intriguing things:

˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘RULES˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘

  1. Please no cheaty methods like Kerbal ladder propulsion or similar. Come on lads, I have faith in you!
  2. Version 1.0 or later, please. Old versions are subject to approved exceptions.
  3. Maintain a manageable part count. No more than 800 parts please.
  4. You must "orbit" around the Equator, or somewhere close to that. Polar orbit is fine as-well. No diagonal or weird-shaped orbits.*
  5. Altitude requirement is to be no less 12,500m and 60,000m. 12,500m is not very survivable, and 60,000m is.. well.. it's just cheating at that point. The in-betweens are up to you.
  6. Your craft must be able to haul at least four Kerbals.
  7. It's a shame that there is no wind on Eve at this time, so you will need to use propulsion. It needs to be 100% sustainable, Eve doesn't need any more carbon than what it already has! The speed of movement must be no less than 10 m/s and no more than 40 m/s. Ion engines (good luck with those), KAX propellers, and other, electric-powered engines / props are allowed.†
  8. The way you get here matters! Provide plenty of documentation (pix) of your trip to Eve. I don't need more than five. Use of HyperEdit is highly prohibited.**
  9. The craft must be stable (altitude-wise). I know it's hard, but it's more than possible. I've accomplished it myself, before I did something wrong and crashed. Do note that my attempt was in version 0.25, and that was a while ago, so a lot of things changed from then, but I have to assume that it's still possible.
  10. Documentation: Papers, Please! Please provide ample documentation (pix) of your entire mission.**²

˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘MODLIST˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘

(^I think this one includes an electric propeller? Correct me if I'm wrong please.^)

(^Seems to work with 1.1.2, but official update not out yet. You can use it anyway.)

Any designing assist mods. Any visual mods. No aerodynamic mods, must use stock physics only. Solar panel and battery mods and mods I've never heard of before are subject to approval.

 

˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘COURT˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘

Badge: your craft meets all the rules (criteria). Good job!

+ 50 points: your craft is very neat-looking. Very subjective and up to me.
+ 75 points: your craft carries ten Kerbals.††
+ 75 points: your craft is under 600 parts.††
+ 100 points: your craft travels at 30 m/s.
+ 100 points: your craft carries fourteen Kerbals.††
+ 200 points: your craft is under 400 parts.††
+ 300 points: your craft carries twenty Kerbals.††
+ 500 points: your craft is under 200 parts.††
+ 500 points: your craft underwent no testing whatsoever, and it is your first attempt. In this case, please provide the documentation for your developmental process in its entirety.
+ 2,000 points: your craft carries 100 Kerbals.††
+ 2,000 points: your craft is under 100 parts.††
+ 5,000 points: your craft is primarily propelled by ion engines. Eve atmosphere.
+ 5,000 points: your craft carries more than 100 Kerbals.††
+ 7,500 points: your craft gets to Eve primarily using electric propulsion of some sort.
+ 10,000 points: your craft consists of a main module, several transportation vehicles for transport around Eve or from base to base, and has many great things that an on-ground base would have.
+ 20,000 points: your craft is reusable.
+ 100,000 points: your craft is 100% stock.
P.S. Let me know if you find any rule / judgement unfair or confusing. I will fix it promptly.

˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘LEADERBOARD˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘

TheOptimist: +50 appearance, +100 speed higher than 30 m/s, +300 more than twenty Kerbals: 450 points.

˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘BADGE˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘˘

P.S.S. Thanks to NASA for the original picture!

Edited June 19, 2016 by 2001kraft
Many!
Is it possible to hover EXACTLY at 0 m/s in Eve's atmosphere horizontally and vertically? This challenge sounds interesting, just wanted to know.
This sounds insane. I figure it should be possible, if you give the balloon enough time, and with decent balancing. I hope a new submission comes up. Please.

5 hours ago, HoloYolo said:

Is it possible to hover EXACTLY at 0 m/s in Eve's atmosphere horizontally and vertically?

With enough balancing, yes. It won't be realistic though, because real life Venus has a huge amount of winds in the atmosphere.

Challenge accepted.

All you have to do is enter the atmosphere, deploy the balloon, activate the auto balancing, and wait for the drag to stop all horizontal motion.

Edited June 12, 2016 by EGB9000

Either everyone is having trouble or no one is interested. Most likely the former .

I'll try something on my own in a couple days.

l kind of want to try this all-stock. It should be more than possible with a large-wing plane, using an SAS powered turboprop, or with good old kerbal pedal power.

...providing i understand this challenge correctly. From what i can understand, the challenge consists of a crewed ship that can fly between 10m/s and 40m/s, at a relatively steady altitude between 12.5 and 60km, and regenerates electricity so it can theoretically fly forever, accompanied by some kind of orbiter ship. Did i get everything?

Also, is kerbal engineer allowed when designing the ship? I sincerely hope so.

2 hours ago, quasarrgames said:

l kind of want to try this all-stock. It should be more than possible with a large-wing plane, using an SAS powered turboprop, or with good old kerbal pedal power.

...providing i understand this challenge correctly. From what i can understand, the challenge consists of a crewed ship that can fly between 10m/s and 40m/s, at a relatively steady altitude between 12.5 and 60km, and regenerates electricity so it can theoretically fly forever, accompanied by some kind of orbiter ship. Did i get everything?

Also, is kerbal engineer allowed when designing the ship? I sincerely hope so.

Orbiter ship (I assume one in space) is not necessary. Yes, steady altitude, between 10-40m/s, and theoretically infinite flight. Please no pedal power though

Kerbal engineer allowed, yes. I should probably specify that also.

Edited June 14, 2016 by 2001kraft

Alright, I said challenge accepted earlier, but my computer doesn't like me taking screenshots of KSP, so it's going to be a while till I get the pictures. However, I did make it and stabilized the vehicle in the upper Evean atmosphere.

Once again, I'll get pictures soon. Probably have to redo it though.

Edited June 16, 2016 by EGB9000

Making progress on the stock version:

Created a compact sustainable propeller plane that should be sustainable at low eve altitudes. I could bolt some seats on to the wings and call it done.

Is it reusable, quasarr? That would be epic, although I have no idea how you would achieve that result. 

Nice to see people interested in this challenge. My submission coming in a day or two, it won't be ideal and will most likely not get any extra points.

Edited June 16, 2016 by 2001kraft
I'm a bit confused by the propulsion mechanism on your aircraft. Could you please post more pictures of the prop?
@EGB9000 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tCWuTKU1gFw
thanks

Got to levitate a small unmanned capsule in upper Eve atmosphere. No propulsion, simply hanging at 30,000m.

Totally possible, this challenge is.

My mission is very similar, just that mine has some electric props on it for movement and landing legs for leaving to the space center. Also has two crew.
